condition: I got very angry with my child or teen and yelled at them
condition_name: I got very angry with my child or te
message_text: @fields.child_nickname

When we take a pause before responding, it helps us to calm down and respond better. Next time @fields.child_nickname makes you angry, try to take a pause first. Even a few deep breaths can make a big difference!

When we take a pause before responding, it helps us to calm down and respond better. Next time your child or teen  makes you angry, try to take a pause first. Even a few deep breaths can make a big difference!

message_text: @fields.child_nickname

This is hard to remember! When you give @fields.child_nickname a choice, you teach @fields.child_nickname decision making skills. It does not always work, but when it does, it helps avoid having to give a consequence and a difficult situation later!

message_text: @fields.child_nickname

Sometimes our children will react in a negative way when receiving a consequence. If @fields.child_nickname is younger than 9 and throws a tantrum, you should ignore your child's behaviour until it is over.  If @fields.child_nickname is older, you might need to walk away until they calm down.

Sometimes our children will react in a negative way when receiving a consequence. If your child is younger than 9 and throws a tantrum, you should ignore your child's behaviour until it is over.  If your child is older, you might need to walk away until they calm down.

message_text: @fields.child_nickname

Check to make sure your consequence is fair and reasonable. For example, if @fields.child_nickname refuses to help put away their toys, try prohibiting playing with them for an evening instead of threatening to throw them away.

Check to make sure your consequence is fair and reasonable. For example, if your child refuses to help put away their toys, try prohibiting playing with them for an evening instead of threatening to throw them away.

condition: I forgot to follow through with the consequence
condition_name: I forgot to follow through with the
message_text: We all make mistakes! The more consistent we are with our consequences, the more likely our children will choose to behave positively in the future.

condition: I am giving too many consequences all the time
condition_name: I am giving too many consequences al
message_text: If you find yourself always having to give consequences to your children for behaving badly, you might need to spend more positive time with them. It will help them feel more loved and secure...and you less stressed!

condition: My child or teen did not need a consequence because they were behaving well
condition_name: My child or teen did not need a cons
message_text: @fields.child_nickname

Great to hear that @fields.child_nickname has been behaving well! The best approach is to avoid having to use consequences in the first place by keeping @fields.child_nickname under a Sunshine of Positive Attention. Invest in quality time and praising @fields.child_nickname's positive behaviour. Redirect works great for avoiding these behaviours, too!
